channel.itunes:author: NPR

item.title: Encore: Astronaut John Glenn Recalls Historic Orbit Of Earth
item.description: Astronaut John Glenn — who was one of NASA's original Mercury Seven — was the first American to orbit Earth. He flew the mission in just under five hours, circling the globe three times in a capsule named Friendship 7. Glenn, who says he recalls the mission as if it were just last week, told NPR's Audie Cornish he doesn't want the U.S. to lose sight of the future and America's role in outer space. This story originally aired on Feb. 20, 2012 on All Things Considered.
item.itunes:author: NPR

item.title: Dakota Access Pipeline Protesters Vow To Fight Through Fierce Winter
item.description: The teeth of winter are closing on the makeshift camp in North Dakota where demonstrators are trying to stop the Dakota Access Pipeline. Some are heeding tribal calls to leave, while others are digging in. But the company building the controversial Dakota Access Pipeline was in federal court Friday, trying to overturn a decision by the Army Corps of Engineers blocking the project.
item.itunes:author: Tim Nelson
item.itunes:summary: The teeth of winter are closing on the makeshift camp in North Dakota where demonstrators are trying to stop the Dakota Access Pipeline. But the company building the controversial Dakota Access Pipeline was in federal court Friday, trying to overturn a decision by the Army Corps of Engineers blocking the project.

item.title: Say, What? Monkey Mouths And Throats Are Equipped For Speech
item.description: Monkeys weren't thought to have the right sort of vocal tracts to speak. But a study finds they can make many sounds common in human speech; it's just that their brains aren't "language ready."
item.itunes:author: Nell Greenfieldboyce
item.itunes:summary: Monkeys weren't thought to have the right sort of vocal tracts to speak. But a study finds they can make many sounds common in human speech; it's just that their brains aren't "language ready."

item.title: A Mummy's DNA May Help Solve The Mystery Of The Origins Of Smallpox
item.description: Scientists have found the oldest complete set of smallpox genes in a sample of skin from a mummified child in a crypt underneath a Lithuanian church.
item.itunes:author: Nell Greenfieldboyce
item.itunes:summary: Scientists have found the oldest complete set of smallpox genes in a sample of skin from a mummified child in a crypt underneath a Lithuanian church.
